enWisdom: The wicked is one who declares [his sins] openly
The one who openly declares his sin is an advertiser [of his disobedience to Allah]
Persistence [in sinning] is the practice of the depraved
Wickedness is from the traits of the disbelievers

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالْمُجَاهَرَةَ بِالْفُجُورِ فَإِنَّهَا مِنْ أَشَدِّ الْمَآثِمِ
enWisdom: Refrain from exposing [your] sins, for this is one of the worst of offences
Verily the wicked comprise of all the oppressive and treacherous people

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ هُنَّ شَيْنُ الدِّينِ الْفُجُورُ وَالْغَدْرُ وَالْخِيَانَةُ
enWisdom: Three things are the disgrace of religion: lewdness, treachery and betrayal [of trust]
The cause of immorality is seclusion

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ لَا يُبَالِي أَنْ يَرَاهُ النَّاسُ مُسِيئاً
enWisdom: The worst person is one who does not care if people see him doing evil

Wisdom: صَارَ الْفُسُوقُ فِي الدُّنْيَا نَسَباً وَالْعَفَافُ عَجَباً وَلَبِسَ الْإِسْلَامُ لُبْسَ الْفَرْوِ مَقْلُوباً
enWisdom: Adultery has become the key to lineage in the world (or among the people), chastity is rare and Islam is worn the wrong way up like fur

Wisdom: فِرُّوا كُلَّ الْفِرَارِ مِنَ الْفَاجِرِ الْفَاسِقِ
enWisdom: Flee far away from the wicked, immoral one
The virtuous one does not seek justice from the vicious

Wisdom: لَا وِزْرَ أَعْظَمُ مِنَ التَّبَجُّحِ بِالْفُجُورِ
enWisdom: One who is persistent in his sin shows audacity in front of the wrath of his Lord

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي لِمَنْ عَرَفَ الْفُجَّارَ أَنْ لَا يَعْمَلَ عَمَلَهُمْ
enWisdom: It behoves one who knows the wicked not to act like them
NULL
God-wariness dignifies, immorality disgraces

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمَحَاضِرَ الْفُسُوقِ فَإِنَّهَا مُسْخِطَةٌ لِلرَّحْمَنِ مُصْلِيَةٌ لِلنِّيرَانِ
enWisdom: Beware of immoral gatherings, for indeed they anger the Most Merciful and take you to the fire of hell
The thing that brings the quickest punishment is a false oath

Wisdom: الْفُجُورُ دَارُ حِصْنٍ ذَلِيلٍ لَا يَمْنَعُ أَهْلَهُ وَلَا يُحْرِزُ مَنْ لَجَأَ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Verily God-wariness is a strong fortress [of protection] for the one who takes refuge in it, and impiety is the dilapidated fortress [of humiliation] which does not protect its people and does not offer security to the one who takes refuge in it
There is no affluence with immorality

Wisdom: لَيْسَ لِكَذُوبٍ أَمَانَةٌ وَلَا لِفَجُورٍ صِيَانَةٌ
enWisdom: There is no trustworthiness in an incessant liar and there is no safeguarding [from sin] in the morally corrupt
There is no [sin for] backbiting for the [openly] corrupt
Indolence is deficiency
Lethargy is the trait of the foolish
Preferring comfort [over hard work] cuts off the means of profit [and benefit]
The bane of action is idleness
The bane of success is laziness

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ يَهْدُدْنَ الْقَوِيَّ فَقْدُ الْأَحِبَّةِ وَالْفَقْرُ فِي الْغُرْبَةِ وَدَوَامُ الشِّدَّةِ
enWisdom: Three things weaken one’s spirit: loss of loved ones, poverty in a strange land and unending hardship
Many a person sits back from that which would delight him

Wisdom: كُنْ مِمَّنْ [مِمَّا] لَا يُفْرِطُ بِهِ عُنْفٌ وَلَا يَقْعُدُ بِهِ ضَعْفٌ
enWisdom: Be from among those who are neither overcome by violence nor affected by weakness
It is from lethargy that laziness originates

Wisdom: لَا تَتَّكِلْ فِي أُمُورِكَ عَلَى كَسْلَانَ
enWisdom: Do not rely on a lazy person in your affairs
Lethargy is [a cause of] loss
Delay [and procrastination] is a chastisement of the soul
Loss comes about through lethargy

Wisdom: التَّوَانِي فِي الدُّنْيَا إِضَاعَةٌ وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ حَسْرَةٌ
enWisdom: Lethargy causes loss in this world and regret in the Hereafter
One who is always lazy, his hopes get dashed
One whose diligence becomes weaker, his opponent gets stronger
One who submits to lethargy forfeits his rights

Wisdom: مَنْ قَعَدَ عَنْ حِيلَتِهِ [جِبِلَّتِهِ‏] أَقَامَتْهُ الشَّدَائِدُ
enWisdom: One who neglects his recourse (or natural disposition) is made to rise [towards it] by tribulations

Wisdom: مَنْ أَطَاعَ التَّوَانِيَ أَحَاطَتْ بِهِ النَّدَامَةُ
enWisdom: One who submits to lethargy is encompassed by regret
